knowledges.speaker: Ross

synsets.definition: have the quality of being; (copula, used with an adjective or a predicate noun)
_examples: John is rich
This is not a good answer

synsets.definition: be identical to; be someone or something
_examples: The president of the company is John Smith
This is my house

synsets.definition: occupy a certain position or area; be somewhere
_examples: Where is my umbrella?" "The toolshed is in the back
What is behind this behavior?

synsets.definition: have an existence, be extant
_examples: Is there a God?

synsets.definition: happen, occur, take place; this was during the visit to my parents' house"
_examples: I lost my wallet
There were two hundred people at his funeral
There was a lot of noise in the kitchen

synsets.definition: be identical or equivalent to
_examples: One dollar equals 1,000 rubles these days!

synsets.definition: form or compose
_examples: This money is my only income
The stone wall was the backdrop for the performance
These constitute my entire belonging
The children made up the chorus
This sum represents my entire income for a year
These few men comprise his entire army

synsets.definition: work in a specific place, with a specific subject, or in a specific function
_examples: He is a herpetologist
She is our resident philosopher

synsets.definition: represent, as of a character on stage
_examples: Derek Jacobi was Hamlet

synsets.definition: spend or use time
_examples: I may be an hour

synsets.definition: have life, be alive
_examples: Our great leader is no more
My grandfather lived until the end of war

synsets.definition: to remain unmolested, undisturbed, or uninterrupted -- used only in infinitive form
_examples: let her be

synsets.definition: be priced at
_examples: These shoes cost $100

knowledges.origin_sent: Sorry I'm late, I was stuck at work.

knowledges.speaker: Ross

synsets.definition: put, fix, force, or implant
_examples: lodge a bullet in the table
stick your thumb in the crack

synsets.definition: stay put (in a certain place); we are not moving to Cincinnati"
_examples: We are staying in Detroit
Stay put in the corner here!
Stick around and you will learn something!

synsets.definition: stick to firmly
_examples: Will this wallpaper adhere to the wall?

synsets.definition: be or become fixed
_examples: The door sticks--we will have to plane it

synsets.definition: endure
_examples: The label stuck to her for the rest of her life

synsets.definition: be a devoted follower or supporter
_examples: The residents of this village adhered to Catholicism
She sticks to her principles

synsets.definition: be loyal to
_examples: She stood by her husband in times of trouble
The friends stuck together through the war

synsets.definition: cover and decorate with objects that pierce the surface
_examples: stick some feathers in the turkey before you serve it

synsets.definition: fasten with an adhesive material like glue
_examples: stick the poster onto the wall

synsets.definition: fasten with or as with pins or nails
_examples: stick the photo onto the corkboard

synsets.definition: fasten into place by fixing an end or point into something
_examples: stick the corner of the sheet under the mattress

synsets.definition: pierce with a thrust using a pointed instrument
_examples: he stuck the cloth with the needle

synsets.definition: pierce or penetrate or puncture with something pointed
_examples: He stuck the needle into his finger

synsets.definition: come or be in close contact with; stick or hold together and resist separation
_examples: The dress clings to her body
The label stuck to the box
The sushi rice grains cohere

synsets.definition: saddle with something disagreeable or disadvantageous
_examples: They stuck me with the dinner bill
I was stung with a huge tax bill

synsets.definition: be a mystery or bewildering to
_examples: This beats me!
Got me--I don't know the answer!
a vexing problem
This question really stuck me

synsets.definition: recall knowledge from memory; have a recollection
_examples: I can't remember saying any such thing
I can't think what her last name was
can you remember her phone number?
Do you remember that he once loved you?
call up memories

synsets.definition: keep in mind for attention or consideration
_examples: Remember the Alamo
Remember to call your mother every day!
Think of the starving children in India!

synsets.definition: recapture the past; indulge in memories
_examples: he remembered how he used to pick flowers

synsets.definition: show appreciation to
_examples: He remembered her in his will

synsets.definition: mention favorably, as in prayer
_examples: remember me in your prayers

synsets.definition: mention as by way of greeting or to indicate friendship
_examples: Remember me to your wife

synsets.definition: exercise, or have the power of, memory
_examples: After the shelling, many people lost the ability to remember
some remember better than others

synsets.definition: call to remembrance; keep alive the memory of someone or something, as in a ceremony
_examples: We remembered the 50th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz
Remember the dead of the First World War
